ProgramName: Master of Arts in Applied History and Public Humanities
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must submit evidence of English language proficiency.
Department: Buchtel College of Arts and Sciences
Description: The Department of History's Master of Arts in Applied History and Public Humanities is an innovative program that offers graduate training in history within a publicly-engaged framework. The program balances rigorous academic training in history with practical applications in the broad field of public humanities, including public history, museums, archives, digital humanities and civic engagement. In addition to a core curriculum in history and public humanities, students gain professional experience through internships and build an online portfolio of their work. The program is ideal for students who wish to pursue a career in the public humanities or a related field, as well as for those who wish to pursue a Ph.D. in history but also want skills and experience that will prepare them for a wider range of professions.

ProgramName: Certificate in Applied Politics
EnglishScore: International applicants must demonstrate English language proficiency. Accepted proofs include: TOEFL with a minimum score of 79 iBT or 550 PBT; IELTS with a minimum overall band score of 6.5; PTE Academic with a minimum score of 53; Duolingo English Test with a minimum score of 110; or successful completion of Level 112 of the ELS English for Academic Purposes.
Requirements: To be admitted to the certificate program, a student must have a baccalaureate degree from an accredited institution of higher learning. Students must meet the standards for admission to The University of Akron Graduate School (including a 2.75 minimum undergraduate GPA). No GRE scores are required for admission into the certificate program.
Department: Buchtel College of Arts and Sciences
Fees: $9,421.50 for the 15-credit program (based on the Ohio Resident Distance Learning rate of $628.10 per credit hour)
Description: The Certificate in Applied Politics is a valuable credential that gives you the knowledge and skills needed to become a leader in political and civic life. The certificate program will allow you to deepen your knowledge of American politics and gain insights into political behavior and processes. You can use the certificate to work toward a full Master of Applied Politics degree. You can earn the certificate as a stand-alone credential or in addition to another graduate degree.

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Arts Administration
EnglishScore: International applicants are required to provide evidence of English proficiency. The Graduate School's minimum required scores are: TOEFL iBT 79 (or 550 PBT), IELTS 6.5, PTE Academic 53, or Duolingo English Test 110. Completion of ELS Language Centers level 112 is also accepted.
Requirements:
To be considered for admission, you will need to complete the following steps:

- Complete the online application
- Pay the application fee
- Submit transcripts from all colleges and universities attended.
- Three letters of recommendation
- A current resume or curriculum vitae
- A statement of purpose (a two-page essay addressing your interest in the program and your career goals).
- International applicants: please note additional requirements.
Department: School of Dance, Theatre, and Arts Administration
Description: Our Master of Arts in Arts Administration (MAAA) program is designed to develop the next generation of creative and innovative leaders in the nonprofit arts sector. Courses are taught by a blend of full-time faculty and community-based practitioners, bringing both academic and real-world experience to the classroom. The program focuses on hands-on application of concepts learned in the classroom, offering multiple opportunities for field-based learning. The capstone experience is an immersive internship that launches students into their professional careers. The MAAA degree provides a rich academic curriculum that partners with the College of Business to address critical topics such as management, marketing, fundraising, finance, entrepreneurship, and board development. We also work with other campus partners to offer additional electives in areas such as social media, event planning and higher education administration.
CostPerCredit: $551.20 per credit hour (in-state); $857.00 per credit hour (out-of-state)
ScholarshipAmount: Full tuition waiver and a stipend of $10,000 for the academic year.

ProgramName: Master of Arts in English: Composition
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English are required to demonstrate objectivity of English language proficiency. Acceptable evidence includes one of the following: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) - minimum score of 79 on the internet-based test (iBT), 550 on the paper-based test (pBT); International English Language Testing System (IELTS) - minimum score of 6.5; Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic - minimum score of 53; Duolingo English Test - minimum score of 105; Successful completion of Level 112 of the ELS Language Centers intensive program.
Requirements: To be considered for admission to the Master of Arts in English program, a student must have a bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university. Usually, this is a degree in English, with at least 24 semester credits in English beyond the first-year composition courses. Students who do not have an undergraduate major in English may be considered for admission if their records show evidence of ability to do graduate work in English. Such students may be required to take some undergraduate English courses to provide an adequate background for their graduate studies. The Department of English does not require Graduate Record Examination (GRE) scores for admission to the MA program. The basic requirements for an application are: A completed online application to The University of Akron Graduate School; Transcripts from all colleges and universities attended; Three letters of recommendation; A statement of purpose; A writing sample.
Department: Buchtel College of Arts and Sciences
Description: The Master of Arts in English at The University of Akron provides students with a strong foundation in literary study and composition. The M.A. program in English has two concentrations: one in Composition and one in Literature. Students work with distinguished faculty who publish and present their research nationally and internationally and who bring their excitement about literature and writing into the classroom. The M.A. in English at UA offers excellent preparation for students interested in Ph.D. programs and in teaching at the secondary or post-secondary levels. Our graduates have also gone on to successful careers in a variety of fields, including editing, marketing, technical writing, and business.
ScholarshipPercentage: Full tuition waiver available via assistantship

ProgramName: Master of Arts in English: Literature
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English language proficiency. Accepted tests and minimum scores include: TOEFL iBT (79) or PBT (550), IELTS (6.5), PTE Academic (53), Duolingo (110), or successful completion of ELS level 112.
Department: Buchtel College of Arts and Sciences
Description: The Master of Arts in English at The University of Akron provides students with an intellectually stimulating and collegial environment to develop a broad knowledge of literary and cultural traditions, to refine their analytical skills, and to develop their abilities as writers, scholars, and teachers. The M.A. in English has long provided an excellent foundation for students who plan to continue their work at the doctoral level, as well as for those who wish to pursue careers in such fields as teaching, writing, editing, and public relations. Our graduates have pursued doctoral study at institutions such as The Ohio State University, the University of Virginia, the University of Texas-Austin, the University of Southern California, the University of North Carolina, the University of Georgia, Pennsylvania State University, Kent State University, and Case Western Reserve University.
ScholarshipAmount: $12,000 stipend plus a full tuition waiver

ProgramName: Master of Science in Geology
EnglishScore: All international applicants must demonstrate English language proficiency. The Graduate School accepts several standardized tests for this purpose, including TOEFL (minimum 79 iBT or 550 PBT), IELTS (minimum 6.5), PTE Academic (minimum 53), Duolingo English Test (minimum 105), or completion of ELS Level 112.
Department: Buchtel College of Arts & Sciences
Description: The Master of Science in Geology program is designed to provide graduate education for students who wish to pursue a professional career in geology or continue with a doctoral degree and for those individuals already employed in the geological or environmental fields who desire to expand their knowledge of the geosciences. The program provides an opportunity for students to do independent research in an area of their own choosing under the supervision of a a faculty member. The department offers a thesis and a non-thesis option for the M.S. degree. Students should consult with their advisor on which of the two options is best suited for their academic and career goals.
ScholarshipAmount: Stipend of approximately $18,000 for the nine-month academic year and a full tuition scholarship.
ScholarshipPercentage: 100% tuition waiver for students with assistantships

ProgramName: PhD in Integrated Bioscience
EnglishScore: All international students must submit proof of English language proficiency. A minimum TOEFL score of 79 (Internet-based) or 550 (paper-based), or a minimum IELTS score of 6.5 is required for full admission to the Graduate School. Other accepted tests include the PTE Academic (53), Duolingo English Test (110), or completion of ELS Level 112.
Requirements: A four-year baccalaureate degree (or its equivalent in other countries) in a science, technology, engineering, or mathematics discipline, from an accredited college or university. A GPA of at least 3.0 out of 4.0. Transcripts. Statement of purpose. Three letters of recommendation. Curriculum vitae (CV) or resume. GRE is optional. TOEFL/IELTS for international students.
Department: Buchtel College of Arts and Sciences
Description: The Integrated Bioscience Ph.D. Program at The University of Akron provides students with a broad background in the life sciences, an intensive research experience in a specialized area, and a curriculum focused on the professional skills required for successful careers. This interdisciplinary program has its administrative home in the Department of Biology but includes faculty from the departments of Biomedical Engineering, Chemistry, Geosciences and Polymer Science. The University of Akron is home to a world-renowned program in polymer science and a rapidly growing program in biomedical engineering. The University's Biomimicry Research and Innovation Center is the only one of its kind in the United States. In addition, the University has partnerships with the Cleveland Clinic Foundation, area hospitals, and is a member of the Northeastern Ohio Medical University (NEOMED). The Integrated Bioscience Program is also part of The University of Akron's new EX[L] Center for Experiential Learning and Civic Engagement. This allows us to provide our graduate students with unique opportunities to integrate research and classroom learning with professional experience through internships and teaching opportunities.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Mathematics: Applied Mathematics
EnglishScore: For international students, proof of English language proficiency is required. Acceptable options include a minimum TOEFL iBT score of 79, TOEFL PBT score of 550, IELTS score of 6.5, PTE Academic score of 53, or Duolingo English Test (DET) score of 110.
Department: Buchtel College of Arts and Sciences
Fees: Ohio Resident (Graduate): approx. $11,126 per year; Non-Ohio Resident (Graduate): approx. $17,163 per year. Based on 2023-24 rates for 9 credits per semester.

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Political Science: Applied Politics
EnglishScore: International applicants must demonstrate English language proficiency by submitting official scores from one of the following examinations: TOEFL iBT (minimum 79), TOEFL PBT (minimum 550), IELTS (minimum 6.5), PTE (minimum 53), Duolingo English Test (minimum 105), or successful completion of ELS Level 112.
Requirements: To be considered for admission, applicants must have a bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution. A grade point average of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale is required. However, students with a GPA between 2.75 and 3.0 may be considered for conditional admission. In addition, applicants should submit: Three letters of recommendation from college instructors who are familiar with your academic work. A statement of purpose (no more than 500 words) that describes your reasons for seeking a master’s degree in applied politics at The University of Akron. A sample of your written academic work (e.g., a term paper from an upper-division course).
Department: Buchtel College of Arts and Sciences
Description: The M.A. in Applied Politics at The University of Akron focuses on politics in the real world. This degree option can equip students to go on for further graduate work in political science and/or to be better informed and engaged citizens. Most students, however, will be interested in a career in politics. Our applied politics program is specifically designed to prepare students for such careers, as campaign managers, fundraisers, political consultants, lobbyists, legislative staff, and in other positions at the local, state, or federal level. The University of Akron’s location provides students with a variety of opportunities. Summit County and neighboring counties have provided UA students with internships in local political parties, numerous campaigns, government offices in Akron, and the county courthouse. Our proximity to the state capital in Columbus has also led to student internships with the Ohio Legislature and the governor’s office. Some of our students have even interned in Washington, D.C.
ScholarshipAmount: Graduate assistantships provide a full tuition waiver and a minimum stipend of $12,000 for a 9-month appointment.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Polymer Engineering
EnglishScore: Applicants who are not native speakers of English must provide evidence of English proficiency. Accepted tests include: TOEFL (79 Internet-based or 550 paper-based), IELTS (6.5), PTE Academic (53), Duolingo (105), or ELS (Completion of Level 112).
Department: School of Polymer Science and Polymer Engineering
Description: The University of Akron's Master of Science (M.S.) in Polymer Engineering program provides students with a thorough understanding of the engineering principles and practices in the polymer industry. The Polymer Engineering M.S. degree is a non-thesis degree that is course-work intensive. Students in this program strengthen their marketability by taking a variety of courses including polymer processing, rheology, composites, thermodynamics, and transport phenomena, among others. The Polymer Engineering M.S. can also be a stepping stone towards a Ph.D. in Polymer Engineering.

ProgramName: PhD in Polymer Science
EnglishScore: Official results of English proficiency tests (e.g. TOEFL or IELTS). Required for international students whose native language is not English. Test must have been taken within the last two years. Minimum TOEFL score is 79 (internet-based) and minimum IELTS score is 6.5. UA's institution code is 1829. A waiver of English proficiency test scores may be requested by applicants who have completed a bachelor's or higher degree from an accredited U.S. institution.
Department: School of Polymer Science and Polymer Engineering
Description:
The University of Akron’s Doctor of Philosophy (Ph.D.) in Polymer Science provides a comprehensive curriculum and diverse research opportunities for students to prepare them to be the next generation of scientists. Our graduates emerge with the skills necessary to lead major research programs in industry, academia and national laboratories. The Ph.D. in Polymer Science program focuses on an interdisciplinary approach that applies the tools of physics, chemistry and engineering to polymer materials.
The UA Polymer Science program is recognized as one of the best in the world. As a result, this program attracts a diverse student body from all over the world. Our research facilities are world class and provide an opportunity for students to experience the full scope of polymer research, from design and synthesis to characterization, processing, and modeling.
CostPerCredit: Ohio Resident: $565.34/credit hour; Non-Ohio Resident: $888.64/credit hour
ScholarshipAmount: $30,000 per year stipend plus tuition and fee waiver
ScholarshipPercentage: 100% of full-time Ph.D. students receive a graduate assistantship

ProgramName: PhD in Psychology: Industrial/Organizational
EnglishScore: All international applicants must demonstrate English language proficiency. One of the following may be submitted to meet this requirement: TOEFL iBT score of 79, IELTS score of 6.5, PTE score of 53, Duolingo English Test score of 110, or successful completion of the ELS Language Centers' Level 112.
Department: Buchtel College of Arts and Sciences
Description: The Industrial/Organizational (I/O) Psychology program at The University of Akron is a top-ranked program dedicated to the scientific study of the workplace. We adhere to the scientist-practitioner model of I/O psychology in which science and practice are viewed as interdependent and mutually beneficial. Through our research and applied projects, we generate and distribute knowledge about people at work to academics, organizations, and the working population. The University of Akron’s I/O Psychology program is a vibrant, research-active, and collaborative community of students and faculty. We offer both the M.A. and Ph.D. degrees in I/O Psychology. Students are admitted to the Ph.D. program and earn their M.A. on the way to the doctorate. We currently have five core faculty members with a wide range of research and applied interests. Our graduates go on to successful careers in both academic and applied settings.
CostPerCredit: Ohio Resident: $565.72/credit hour; Non-Ohio Resident: $886.50/credit hour
ScholarshipAmount: Full tuition waiver plus a stipend of $18,000 - $18,500 per year

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Psychology: Industrial/Organizational
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must submit proof of English proficiency by one of the options below. The tests must have been taken within the past two years. Options include: TOEFL with a minimum score of 79 on the internet-based test (iBT) or 550 on the paper-based test (PBT); IELTS with a minimum overall score of 6.5; Duolingo with a minimum score of 110; PTE Academic with a minimum score of 53; or successful completion of ELS Language Center's level 112.
Department: Buchtel College of Arts and Sciences
Description: The Industrial/Organizational (I/O) Psychology program at The University of Akron is dedicated to the scientific study of the workplace and the application of psychological principles to workplace issues. We have a long and distinguished history as one of the nation's top-ranked I/O psychology graduate programs. Our program follows the scientist-practitioner model, which emphasizes the connection between theory and application. Our M.A. program provides students with a solid foundation in the core areas of I/O psychology. Students are trained to use appropriate research methods and statistical techniques to solve real-world problems. Most of our M.A. students are employed full time in business, industry, and government organizations.
ScholarshipAmount: Full tuition waiver plus a minimum stipend of $10,000 for the nine-month academic year for graduate assistants.

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Speech-Language Pathology
EnglishScore: For applicants whose native language is not English, The University of Akron requires official, passing results from one of the following tests: TOEFL (79 iBT or 550 PBT), IELTS (6.5 overall band score), PTE Academic (53), Duolingo English Test (115 or higher), or ELS Language Centers (Level 112).
Requirements: A bachelor's degree from a regionally accredited institution with an overall GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale is required. Applicants must have completed prerequisite coursework in speech-language pathology and audiology or hold an undergraduate degree in the field. The following documents are required for application via the CSDCAS portal: official transcripts from all universities and colleges attended, three letters of recommendation, a curriculum vita (CV)/resume, a written response to the essay questions, and a statement of intent describing your background, career goals, and reasons for pursuing a graduate degree in speech-language pathology. Official GRE scores are recommended for all applicants, but are not required. TOEFL scores are required for international applicants.
Department: School of Speech-Language Pathology and Audiology
Fees: $665.41 per credit hour for Ohio Residents, $1,059.95 per credit hour for Non-Ohio Residents (2024-2025 rates). The program requires a minimum of 53 credits.
Description: The Master of Arts (M.A.) education program in speech-language pathology at The University of Akron is designed to provide students with the academic and clinical experiences necessary to become a competent, compassionate, and reflective speech-language pathologist. Our master's program can be completed in five semesters of full-time study. Part-time options are also available. Students in the program develop a strong foundation in the scientific bases of human communication sciences and disorders, as well as the theoretical principles of assessment and intervention. We believe in providing students with a rich and robust clinical experience that spans the full scope of speech-language pathology practice. We embrace an evidence-based practice framework that integrates foundational knowledge, clinical expertise, and client values. Students who complete the master's program will be prepared to work as a speech-language pathologist across a variety of clinical and educational settings.
Accredidation: The Master of Arts (M.A.) education program in speech-language pathology (residential) at The University of Akron is accredited by the Council on Academic Accreditation in Audiology and Speech-Language Pathology (CAA) of the American Speech-Language-Hearing Association, 2200 Research Boulevard, #310, Rockville, MD 20850, 800-498-2071 or 301-296-5700.
CostPerCredit: $665.41 per credit hour for Ohio Residents, $1,059.95 per credit hour for Non-Ohio Residents

ProgramName: Master of Science in Statistics
EnglishScore: International applicants whose native language is not English are required to take an English proficiency test. Acceptable tests and minimum scores: TOEFL - 79 ibt or 550 pbt; IELTS - 6.5; PTE - 53; Duolingo - 110; ELS - Completion of ELS Level 112 with a grade of B or better.
Requirements: A bachelor's degree from an accredited institution. An overall GPA of 3.0 out of 4.0 or equivalent. Sufficient mathematical background, including three semesters of calculus (differential, integral and multivariable calculus), and a course in linear algebra. A TOEFL score of 79 or higher (for international students only). A resume. A statement of purpose. Two letters of recommendation. GRE scores are NOT required.
Department: Buchtel College of Arts and Sciences
Description: The Master of Science (M.S.) in Statistics program at The University of Akron provides students with a solid foundation in statistical theory, methodology, and applications. The program will equip students with the skills they need to pursue a career in industry, government or a Ph.D. program in statistics or a related field. The M.S. degree has thesis and non-thesis options. Graduates find success in a number of fields, including bioinformatics, biostatistics, economics, epidemiology, finance, marketing, public policy, psychology, and sociology.

ProgramName: Doctor of Audiology (Au.D.)
EnglishScore: International students must demonstrate English proficiency by submitting one of the following official test scores: TOEFL iBT: 79; TOEFL PBT: 550; IELTS: 6.5; PTE Academic: 53; Duolingo English Test: 110; or ELS Language Center: Successful completion of Level 112.
Department: School of Speech-Language Pathology and Audiology
Fees: An estimated $27,713 per year for a full-time resident student, which includes per-credit tuition and mandatory program fees.
Description: The Doctor of Audiology (Au.D.) program at The University of Akron is a four-year, post-baccalaureate degree. We prepare students to become audiologists by developing competencies in the areas of prevention, identification, assessment, and (re)habilitation of hearing, auditory function, balance, and other related systems. Our program provides a wide variety of clinical experiences, both on and off campus, under the direct supervision of audiologists who hold certification from the American Speech-Language-Hearing Association and/or are fellows of the American Academy of Audiology. Graduates of the Au.D. program are eligible for state licensure in audiology, certification from the American Speech-Language-Hearing Association (CCC-A), and board certification from the American Board of Audiology.
Accredidation: The Doctor of Audiology (Au.D.) residential program at The University of Akron is accredited by the Council on Academic Accreditation in Audiology and Speech-Language Pathology of the American Speech-Language-Hearing Association, 2200 Research Boulevard, #310, Rockville, MD 20850, 800-498-2071 or 301-296-5700.
CostPerCredit: $690.42 (Resident), $1,041.02 (Non-Resident). An additional $3,500 Career Advantage Au.D. Grad Program Fee is assessed per term.
CollegeApplicationFee: An estimated $27,713 per year for a full-time resident student, which includes per-credit tuition and mandatory program fees.
ScholarshipType: Graduate assistantships, tuition scholarships, and research grants

ProgramName: Master of Science in Biology
EnglishScore: All international applicants are required to submit an English language proficiency test score unless they meet one of the exemptions. Accepted tests and minimum required scores: TOEFL iBT: 79, TOEFL PBT: 550, IELTS: 6.5, PTE Academic: 53, Duolingo English Test: 110, ELS Language Center: Successful completion of Level 112.
Requirements: Applicants to the Master of Science in Biology program must submit the following materials to the Graduate School: An online application and application fee; Official transcripts from all universities and colleges attended; Three letters of recommendation from individuals who can assess your potential for graduate study; Graduate Record Examination (GRE) general test scores (verbal, quantitative and analytical writing) are optional for all applicants; A statement of purpose (1-2 pages) that describes your research interests and experience, career goals, and the faculty members you are interested in working with; A resume/curriculum vitae (CV) summarizing your background and experience. International applicants must submit TOEFL or IELTS scores that meet the minimum requirements of the Graduate School.
Department: Buchtel College of Arts and Sciences
Concentration: Ecology and Evolutionary Biology, Physiology, Molecular/Cellular Biology
Description: The graduate programs in Biology are designed to provide students with advanced training in modern biological principles and research methods. The department offers M.S. and Ph.D. degrees with specializations in ecology and evolutionary biology, physiology, and molecular/cellular biology. The department has a close working relationship with area institutions and agencies including the Cleveland Metroparks Zoo, Cleveland Museum of Natural History, Cuyahoga Valley National Park, and the University of Akron Field Station. This collaboration provides students with a diversity of research opportunities. The M.S. degree is excellent preparation for careers in government, industry, and education, or as preparation for further graduate work.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Business: Accountancy
Department: College of Business
Description: The Master of Science in Accountancy (MSA) degree program is designed to provide students an opportunity for advanced study in accountancy. The MSA is designed to meet the needs of both career-changers and those students who are already working in the accounting profession. For a student with an undergraduate degree in accounting, the MSA will provide the greater breadth and depth in accounting and business that is necessary for a successful accounting career. For a student with an undergraduate degree in a field other than accounting, the MSA will provide the educational background necessary for a career in accounting. Graduates of the MSA program will be prepared for accounting careers in public accounting, industry, not-for-profit, and government. The MSA is also excellent preparation for doctoral studies and a career in academics.
Accredidation: The School of Accountancy is separately accredited by the AACSB International for both its undergraduate and graduate programs. This separate accreditation is the hallmark of an excellent accounting program.
ScholarshipAmount: The University Fellowship provides a $12,000 stipend plus a full tuition scholarship.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Business: Management, Information Systems
EnglishScore: International applicants must demonstrate English language proficiency with a minimum score of 79 on TOEFL iBT, 6.5 on IELTS, 53 on PTE Academic, 110 on the Duolingo English Test, or completion of ELS Language Center's Level 112. This requirement may be waived for citizens of or those who have earned a degree from an institution in certain English-speaking countries.
Requirements:
Bachelor's degree from an accredited institution. A business degree is not required.
Undergraduate GPA of 2.75 or higher.
Resume
Statement of purpose/goals
Three letters of recommendation
Applicants whose native language is not English must submit the results from the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) or the International English Language Testing System (IELTS).
Department: George W. and Angelina S. College of Business Administration
Fees: $19,964.40 (Ohio Resident, total program), $32,268 (Non-Ohio Resident, total program)
Description: The Master of Science in Management (M.S.M.) in Information Systems (I.S.) track provides students an opportunity to combine their interests in both business and information technology. This unique mix of courses provides students with the management and technical expertise required for a broad range of technology-related business careers in information systems. The program will equip students with knowledge and skills in systems analysis and design, project management, database management, business intelligence and analytics. Graduates of the program will have the flexibility to pursue careers in a wide range of industries.
Accredidation: The College of Business is accredited by AACSB International in both business and accounting, an honor held by fewer than 2% of business schools worldwide.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Business: Management, Supply Chain Management
EnglishScore: Applicants for whom English is not their native language must submit one of the following: TOEFL (iBT minimum 79 or PBT minimum 550), IELTS (minimum 6.5), PTE Academic (minimum 53), Duolingo English Test (minimum 105), or completion of level 112 at an ELS Language Center. An exemption may be granted for applicants who have earned a bachelor's, master's or doctoral degree from a regionally accredited U.S. college or university.
Department: College of Business
Description: The Supply Chain Management track in the M.S. in Management program is designed for students with a variety of backgrounds. Students will develop their knowledge and skills in supply chain management which consists of a set of approaches utilized to efficiently integrate suppliers, manufacturers, warehouses and stores. With an M.S. Management in SCM, students will be prepared for management positions in the supply chain field, such as logistics, purchasing and operations.
Accredidation: The College of Business is accredited at the bachelor's and master's levels by AACSB International - The Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business. This is the highest level of accreditation a business school can achieve.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Chemistry
EnglishScore: International students must also submit scores from the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL). A minimum score of 79 on the internet-based TOEFL is required.
Requirements: Applications from all qualified students who have completed a baccalaureate degree in chemistry or a related discipline are welcome. The following requirements must be met: A bachelor’s degree in chemistry (or a closely related discipline) from an accredited institution. An overall GPA of 3.0 or better is required (on a 4.0 scale). Unofficial transcripts from all universities and colleges attended are required during the application process. Official transcripts are required after admission is offered. Three letters of recommendation. GRE is not required. TOEFL scores are required for all international applicants, with a minimum required score of 79.
Department: Buchtel College of Arts and Sciences
Fees: $10,420.56/Year (In-State, estimate based on 18 credits including all fees)
Description: The Master of Science in Chemistry is a thesis-based degree program designed to provide students with the laboratory and communication skills necessary for professional employment in chemistry-related fields or to successfully compete for admission into Ph.D. programs.
CollegeApplicationFee: In addition to tuition, there is a $12.00 per credit hour Chemistry Fee, a General Service Fee ($45.68/credit), and a Technology Fee ($15.50/credit).

ProgramName: PhD in Chemistry
EnglishScore: All international applicants must demonstrate English language proficiency. Accepted tests include TOEFL (minimum 79), IELTS (minimum 6.5), PTE (minimum 53), Duolingo English Test (minimum 110), or completion of Level 112 at an ELS Language Center.
Department: Buchtel College of Arts and Sciences
Concentration: Analytical Chemistry, Biochemistry, Inorganic Chemistry, Organic Chemistry, Physical Chemistry
Description: The Department of Chemistry and Biochemistry provides comprehensive graduate training in the chemical sciences, offering both MS and PhD degrees in chemistry and biochemistry. Graduate study is centered on a vigorous and exciting research environment where students learn state-of-the-art chemical techniques while making important contributions to the chemical sciences. Graduate students choose a research advisor from among our active and internationally-recognized research faculty. Our department is committed to creating a safe, inclusive, and diverse research and learning environment that is welcoming to all.

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Child and Family Development
EnglishScore: All international applicants must submit evidence of English proficiency, regardless of citizenship or residency status. This requirement can be met by submitting one of several options, including TOEFL (79 iBT or 550 PBT), IELTS (6.5), PTE (53), Duolingo (105), or ELS (Level 112).
Requirements:
Admission to the Master of Arts in Child and Family Development program is based upon the following criteria:
- A four-year baccalaureate degree (or its equivalent) from an accredited college or university.
- A grade point average of at least 3.00 on a 4.00 scale.
- Official transcripts from each college or university where you have earned 8 or more credits. Please have your transcripts sent to gradsch@uakron.edu.
- A written statement of personal and professional goals.
- Three letters of recommendation.
- A resume.
- The GRE is not required.
Department: School of Education
Concentration: Child Life, Family Life Education, and Program Administration and Leadership
Description: The Master of Arts in Child and Family Development focuses on the development of children and families, and the social, cultural and economic contexts in which they live. The program prepares students to work with families and children in a variety of social service settings. The program is offered fully online. The program is intended to increase students’ knowledge about how to improve the quality of life for children and families. In addition to a core of coursework related to children and families, students have a choice of several specialized areas of study: Child Life, Family Life Education, and Program Administration and Leadership.
Accredidation: The Child Life specialization is endorsed by the Association of Child Life Professionals (ACLP), verifying that our coursework meets their academic requirements for certification.
ScholarshipAmount: Stipends range between $8,000 and $18,000 for the nine-month academic year, plus a full tuition scholarship and waiver of the general university fee.

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Communication
EnglishScore: All international applicants are required to provide proof of English language proficiency. Minimum scores are: TOEFL iBT: 79; IELTS: 6.5; PTE: 53; Duolingo English Test: 105; or successful completion of Level 112 at an ELS Language Center.
Department: Buchtel College of Arts and Sciences
Fees: $9,468.36/Year for Ohio residents, $15,239.34/Year for non-residents (based on 18 credits per year)
Description: The School of Communication offers a Master of Arts (M.A.) degree with study in a variety of areas, including interpersonal, media studies, organizational, and public relations. Our program is designed to provide students with a sophisticated understanding of communication theory and research, which will prepare them for a variety of career objectives. Our graduates have successfully pursued doctoral degrees, advanced professionally, and begun new careers in a variety of organizations in the corporate, governmental, and non-profit sectors. Our faculty have expertise in a variety of areas, including conflict, health, instructional, interpersonal, intercultural, media, organizational, public relations, risk and crisis, social influence, and social media. We offer three program options: a thesis option, a project option, and a comprehensive examination option. Students can also earn a certificate in Health Communication or Integrated Marketing Communication.

ProgramName: PhD in Counseling Psychology
EnglishScore: Applicants are required to take one of the following exams and receive the minimum score to be considered for admission: TOEFL iBT minimum score of 79, TOEFL PBT minimum score of 550, IELTS minimum overall band score of 6.5, PTE minimum score of 53, or Duolingo English Test minimum score of 110. UA also accepts successful completion of Level 112 at an ELS Language Center in the U.S. in place of the tests listed above.
Requirements:
The deadline for applications for the Counseling Psychology Ph.D. program is December 1st for Fall admission. All application materials, including those sent from other institutions (i.e. letters of recommendation and transcripts), must be received by this date to be considered for admission. Our program uses a mentorship model and applicants must identify one or two potential faculty advisors in their personal statement.

Application Materials to be Submitted Online:
- Completed University of Akron Graduate School online application
- A current résumé or curriculum vita (CV)
- A personal statement of 2-3 pages that describes your interest in counseling psychology, our program in particular, and your professional goals. Please also identify one or two faculty members with whom you would like to work and describe how your research interests align with their work.
- Three letters of recommendation. Please request letters from individuals who can attest to your academic ability and your potential for graduate study in psychology.
- Transcripts from ALL colleges and universities attended.
- The Graduate Record Examination (GRE) is not required for admission to this program.
- A writing sample. Please choose a paper written for an undergraduate or graduate course that you feel best represents your writing ability.
Department: College of Health and Human Sciences
Description: The Counseling Psychology Ph.D. program at The University of Akron is a scientist-practitioner based program with a strong social justice mission that prepares students for careers as counseling psychologists in a variety of settings. The program has been continuously accredited by the American Psychological Association (APA) since 1987. The University of Akron’s Counseling Psychology Ph.D. program emphasizes the following areas: multicultural competence and social justice, group work, research, supervision and training, and psychological assessment. We seek students who are interested in becoming leading practitioners and researchers. The program typically takes 5 years to complete, including a yearlong internship. Our Ph.D. program is one of only two APA-accredited doctoral programs in Counseling Psychology in the state of Ohio.
Accredidation: The program has been continuously accredited by the American Psychological Association (APA) since 1987.
ScholarshipAmount: $15,000 stipend and a full tuition waiver

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Counseling: Clinical Mental Health Counseling
EnglishScore: All international applicants must submit evidence of English language proficiency. Acceptable evidence includes minimum scores on the TOEFL (79 iBT or 550 PBT), IELTS (6.5), PTE Academic (53), Duolingo English Test (110), or completion of ELS Level 112.
Requirements: Graduate School application and fee; Official transcripts from all institutions attended; GPA of at least 3.0 on a 4.0 scale; Three letters of recommendation; Statement of purpose; Resume/CV; GRE scores - (Waived for Fall 2024 admissions); Interview with program faculty
Department: School of Counseling
Description: The Master of Arts in Clinical Mental Health Counseling is a 60-semester-hour program designed to prepare counseling professionals to work with individuals, families, and groups to address personal and social problems. Students are prepared to practice in a variety of settings, such as community mental health centers, hospitals, private counseling agencies, and private practice. Graduates of this program are qualified to seek licensure as a professional counselor in Ohio and in most other states.
Accredidation: The Clinical Mental Health Counseling Program at The University of Akron is accredited by the Council for Accreditation of Counseling and Related Educational Programs (CACREP).

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Counseling: Marriage and Family Therapy/Counseling
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English language proficiency. The University of Akron Graduate School accepts TOEFL, IELTS, PTE Academic, and Duolingo English Test scores.
Department: School of Counseling
Description: The Marriage and Family Therapy/Counseling (MFT/C) program is a 60-semester hour, CACREP-accredited program that prepares students with specialized knowledge and skills to work with individuals, couples, and families from a systemic/relational perspective. The program is designed to meet the educational requirements for licensure in the state of Ohio as a Licensed Professional Counselor (LPC) and a Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist (LMFT). The program has also been approved by the International Registry of Counsellor Education Programmes (IRCEP), an international affiliate of CACREP, which facilitates opportunities for our graduates to seek credentials in other countries.
Accredidation: The Marriage and Family Therapy/Counseling (MFT/C) program is a ... CACREP-accredited program. ... The program has also been approved by the International Registry of Counsellor Education Programmes (IRCEP), an international affiliate of CACREP...

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Education: School Counseling
LiveDate: August of the year prior to admission
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must submit proof of English proficiency unless they have a bachelor's or master's degree from a U.S. institution. The University of Akron accepts TOEFL, IELTS, PTE and Duolingo.
Department: LeBron James Family Foundation School of Education
Description: The School Counseling Program at The University of Akron is a 60-semester-hour, CACREP-accredited program that prepares students to meet the academic, career, and social/emotional developmental needs of children and adolescents in schools. Students are prepared to become professional school counselors in elementary, middle, and high school settings. The program meets the academic requirements for the State of Ohio Department of Education School Counselor license (K-12). It also provides the academic background necessary for students to become Licensed Professional Counselors (LPC) in the state of Ohio. Students complete a common core of counseling classes along with specific coursework in school counseling. This program requires both a practicum (100 hours) and an internship (600 hours). Students interested in pursuing a doctoral degree in Counselor Education and Supervision can transition into our Ph.D. program. The School Counseling program is offered in a traditional (in-person) format on the main campus in Akron.
Accredidation: CACREP-accredited

ProgramName: PhD in Engineering: Polymer Engineering
EnglishScore: International applicants are required to demonstrate proficiency in the English language. Applicants must submit one of the following: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) with a minimum score of 79 (internet-based) or 550 (paper-based); International English Language Testing System (IELTS) with a minimum score of 6.5; Pearson Test of English (PTE) with a minimum score of 53; Duolingo with a minimum score of 110; or successful completion of ELS Language Centers Level 112.
Department: College of Engineering and Polymer Science
Description: The Doctor of Philosophy in Engineering degree program at The University of Akron is an interdisciplinary program that provides students with an opportunity to perform high level and ground-breaking research. Students select a specialization within one of the engineering disciplines offered through our five engineering departments. The College of Engineering and Polymer Science has a strong research reputation and is consistently ranked among the best engineering schools. Our faculty are active researchers, leaders in their fields, and are always looking to take on motivated students in their research group. The faculty work collaboratively with a number of centers on campus, industries, and government labs. Our Ph.D. students are highly sought after by industry, national labs and academia.
ScholarshipAmount: Stipends for the 2023-24 academic year are $30,000

ProgramName: Master of Business Administration with Concentration in Business Analytics
EnglishScore: All international applicants must demonstrate English proficiency. Minimum scores for admission without condition are: 79 for the internet-based TOEFL (iBT), 550 for the paper-based TOEFL (PBT), 6.5 for the IELTS, 53 for the PTE, or 110 for the Duolingo English Test. Successful completion of the ELS Language Centers' Level 112 is also accepted. Some applicants may be exempt from this requirement.
Department: College of Business
Description: The University of Akron's Master of Business Administration (MBA) degree program is designed for individuals who have a bachelor's degree in any field. The program emphasizes strategic decision-making and developing skills to succeed in a rapidly changing business climate. The College of Business is one of only 194 business schools in the world to hold dual accreditation from AACSB International in both business and accounting. Why Akron? The UA MBA provides an excellent return on investment. Our program is flexible, affordable and high-quality, giving you the skills needed to compete in a global economy. We offer a wide range of graduate business courses that enable you to customize your education to meet your career goals. In addition to a general MBA, we offer 12 specializations, including a new specialization in healthcare management.
Accredidation: The College of Business is one of only 194 business schools in the world to hold dual accreditation from AACSB International in both business and accounting.

ProgramName: Master of Business Administration with Concentration in Finance
EnglishScore: International applicants must provide proof of English proficiency. Accepted tests include TOEFL (minimum 79 iBT or 550 PBT), IELTS (minimum 6.5), PTE Academic (minimum 53), or Duolingo English Test (minimum 105). Completion of Level 112 of the ELS Language Centers' Intensive English Program also satisfies this requirement.
Department: College of Business
Description: The Master of Business Administration (MBA) program at The University of Akron is designed for individuals from all academic backgrounds who are ready to lead, innovate, and make a significant impact in the business world. Our program is tailored to provide a flexible, yet rigorous curriculum that combines core business principles with specialized knowledge, preparing you for the challenges of today's dynamic global market. Our program is offered in three flexible formats to fit your schedule: Traditional Part-Time MBA (on-campus), Online MBA (100% online), and a Full-Time Two-Year MBA Cohort. Each of these options delivers the same high-quality education and access to our dedicated faculty and resources. Whether you are looking to advance in your current career, switch industries, or start your own venture, our MBA program provides the tools, network, and experience to achieve your professional goals.
Accredidation: The University of Akron’s College of Business is one of only 190 universities in the world to hold dual AACSB accreditation in both business and accounting.
CostPerCredit: $776.42 per credit hour for Ohio residents, $1,192.83 per credit hour for non-residents

ProgramName: Master of Business Administration with Concentration in Risk Management & Insurance
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must submit evidence of English language proficiency. The Graduate School accepts any one of the following: TOEFL iBT minimum score 79, IELTS minimum score 6.5, PTE Academic minimum score 53, Duolingo English Test minimum score 110, or successful completion of ELS Language Centers Level 112.
Department: College of Business
Fees: Approximately $24,700 for the entire program for Ohio residents and $38,100 for non-residents.
Description: The University of Akron’s Master of Business Administration (MBA) program gives students a global perspective on business, a strategic mindset to overcome challenges, and the confidence to build and lead teams. Students will develop their knowledge and skills in functional areas of business, including finance, management, and marketing. Our program is designed for working professionals, offering a flexible format to complete the program in two years or at your own pace. With Saturday and online MBA options available, students can earn their degree while working full-time. The Risk Management and Insurance concentration prepares students for leadership positions in the corporate risk management and insurance fields. Course topics include corporate risk management, employee benefits, insurance operations, and more.
Accredidation: The College of Business is accredited by AACSB International, the premier accrediting agency for business schools.
ScholarshipAmount: Stipends for graduate assistantships range from $4,500 to $9,000 per academic year.

ProgramName: Master of Business Administration with Concentration in Global Technological Innovation
Master of Business Administration with Concentration in Health Care Management
EnglishScore: If your native language is not English, you will need to submit proof of English proficiency. Accepted tests include TOEFL (minimum score of 79 iBT or 550 PBT), IELTS (minimum score of 6.5), PTE (minimum score of 53), Duolingo (minimum score of 105), or successful completion of ELS Language Centers Level 112.
Department: College of Business
Description: The Master of Business Administration (MBA) program at The University of Akron is designed for individuals who are looking for a graduate business program that helps them grow as a business leader, professionally and personally. Our program provides a global perspective of business, a strategic point of view, and a focus on responsible leadership and ethical decision-making. Students master the functional areas of business and learn to apply this knowledge in a team setting. By focusing on the development of these skills, our graduates are prepared to meet the challenges of the competitive global business environment. With flexible class options, a diverse student body, and a dedicated career services office, the UA MBA offers a great opportunity for students to move forward in their career and in their life.
Accredidation: The College of Business is one of only 190 universities in the world to hold dual AACSB accreditation in business and accounting.
ScholarshipAmount: Minimum stipend of $12,000 for a nine-month contract, plus a full tuition scholarship for graduate assistants.

ProgramName: Master of Business Administration with Concentration in Interdisciplinary
EnglishScore: The University of Akron requires one of the following as proof of English proficiency: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) iBT score of 79 (or 550 for paper-based test), International English Language Testing System (IELTS) score of 6.5, Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic score of 53, Duolingo score of 110, or Successful completion of the English Language Institute's Level 112.
Requirements: In addition to the requirements of the Graduate School, the College of Business Administration requires that applicants submit scores from the Graduate Management Admission Test (GMAT) or the Graduate Record Examination (GRE), a current résumé, statement of purpose and two letters of recommendation.
Department: College of Business Administration
Fees: Ohio Resident: $25,615.08 (total for 36 credits); Non-Ohio Resident: $42,313.68 (total for 36 credits)
Description: The Interdisciplinary Concentration MBA is a flexible program designed for individuals whose educational or career objectives are not met by the structured concentrations offered within the College of Business. The plan of study is mutually developed by the student and the MBA Programs Office to meet specific academic and career goals. An Interdisciplinary MBA requires a minimum of nine elective credits at the 600 level that are concentrated in a specific area. These electives may be from a discipline outside the College of Business such as communication, engineering, or law.
Accredidation: AACSB International

ProgramName: Master of Business Administration with Concentration in International Business
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English language proficiency. You must submit a satisfactory score from one of the following tests: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) - Internet-based test (iBT): 79, International English Language Testing System (IELTS): 6.5, Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic: 53, Duolingo English Test: 110, ELS Language Centers: Level 112.
Requirements: To be considered for admission to the MBA program, applicants must have a bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university. The Admissions Committee considers the complete application package, including academic background, GMAT/GRE scores (if not waived), work experience, resume, letter of recommendation, and personal statement.
Department: College of Business
Fees: The total investment for the MBA program can be as low as $25,000
Description: The Master of Business Administration (MBA) program at The University of Akron is designed to provide graduate students from all backgrounds the opportunity to greatly enhance their business career. We offer several options to help students with different needs and backgrounds reach their goals. The Flexible MBA is a part-time option and our most popular program. We also offer a full-time option called the Accelerated MBA. Graduates of our MBA program go on to become successful managers and leaders in a wide variety of industries and sectors including corporate, non-profit, and government.
Accredidation: The College of Business is accredited in both business and accounting by AACSB International (the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business).
CostPerCredit: $681.42 per credit hour (Ohio Resident), $1,073.34 per credit hour (Non-Ohio Resident)

ProgramName: Master of Business Administration with Concentration in Management
EnglishScore: International applicants must demonstrate English proficiency. Accepted tests include TOEFL (minimum 79 iBT or 550 PBT), IELTS (minimum 6.5), PTE (minimum 53), or Duolingo (minimum 110). Completion of the University of Akron’s English Language Institute program or waivers for applicants from specific countries or with U.S. degrees are also options.
Department: College of Business
Fees: $24,837.12 (Ohio Resident, for 36 credits), $35,727.12 (Non-Ohio Resident, for 36 credits)
Description: The Master of Business Administration (MBA) degree at The University of Akron is a dynamic program that balances a deep understanding of business theory with a strong focus on real-world applications. Our flexible program is designed for students with an undergraduate degree in any major. We teach you how to think critically and analytically, communicate effectively, and lead with purpose. The MBA program provides a broad foundation across all business disciplines, including accounting, finance, management, and marketing. You will develop critical business skills and gain insights into leading in the global economy. All this in a program that works for you: classes are offered on campus at night and online. Our MBA degree is flexible, with options to customize your degree. You can earn an MBA with a concentration, add a graduate business certificate, or participate in a joint degree program. All options add great value to your MBA degree.
Accredidation: The College of Business is one of only 194 business schools in the world to hold dual accreditation in business and accounting from AACSB International. This achievement signifies our commitment to quality business education and places us in the top 5% of business schools worldwide.
ScholarshipAmount: Up to $2,000; Graduate Assistantships include a full tuition waiver and stipend

ProgramName: Master of Business Administration with Concentration in Strategic Marketing
EnglishScore: International applicants for whom English is not their native language must submit one of the following: TOEFL iBT (minimum score 79), IELTS (minimum score 6.5), PTE Academic (minimum score 53), Duolingo (minimum score 105), or ELS Level 112 with a 2.5 GPA. The requirement is waived for applicants who have earned a bachelor’s degree or higher from an accredited U.S. college or university, or from a pre-approved foreign university where English is the language of instruction.
Department: College of Business
Description: The University of Akron’s Master of Business Administration (MBA) program prepares you for advancement in any industry by offering high-quality and flexible options to fit your lifestyle. Designed for professionals who want to lead and make data-driven business decisions, this program provides the tools you need to effectively manage people, resources, and projects, no matter where your career takes you. Our curriculum gives you a broad foundation in business skills, from finance and marketing to management and supply chain operations. You can also further customize your program by choosing from one of six concentrations or a general MBA. Best of all, you can do it on your own schedule, in a way that makes sense for you.
Accredidation: AACSB-accredited College of Business

ProgramName: Master of Business Administration with Concentration in Supply Chain Management
EnglishScore: For international applicants, a TOEFL, IELTS, PTE, Duolingo, or ELS score is required unless waiver requirements are met. Minimum scores for full admission are: TOEFL iBT 79 or PBT 550, IELTS 6.5, PTE Academic 53, Duolingo 110, or ELS level 112 completion.
Department: College of Business
Description: Supply chain management (SCM) encompasses the planning and management of all activities in sourcing and procurement, conversion, and all logistics management activities. Importantly, it also includes coordination and collaboration with channel partners, which can be suppliers, intermediaries, third-party service providers, and customers. In essence, supply chain management integrates supply and demand management within and across companies. For students interested in a career in this high-demand field, the Supply Chain Management concentration focuses on managing the flow of goods, services, and information, from the source to the end user. This program covers topics such as logistics, procurement, inventory management, and operations management.
Accredidation: The College of Business is accredited by AACSB International in both business and accounting – a distinction held by fewer than 1% of business schools worldwide.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Management with Concentration in Information Systems Management
EnglishScore: The Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) is required if a student's native language is not English. TOEFL scores must have been obtained within two years of the date of application. For applicants required to take the TOEFL, the minimum acceptable score is 550 (paper-based), 213 (computer-based), or 79 (Internet-based). The International English Language Testing System (IELTS) exam is also accepted. The minimum IELTS score is 6.5.
Requirements:
The following are required to be admitted into the program:

*   A bachelor's degree from an accredited institution.
*   A minimum GPA of 3.0.
*   Graduate Management Admission Test (GMAT) score of 500 or higher (or GRE equivalent).
*   A current resume.
*   A letter of intent/purpose.
*   Letters of recommendation.
*   An official transcript from each university or college attended. Transcripts must be sent directly from the institution to The University of Akron Graduate School.
*   International applicants may also need to submit proof of English proficiency.
Department: College of Business
Description: The MSM-Information Systems Management (ISM) concentration is designed for business professionals who want to advance their careers in the information systems field. The program appeals to professionals currently working in the areas of information systems, as well as those who desire to transition to the IS field. The curriculum provides a thorough understanding of the technical and managerial issues associated with designing, developing, implementing and managing information systems.
Accredidation: The undergraduate and graduate programs in the College of Business are accredited by AACSB International - The Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business.
CostPerCredit: Ohio Resident: $717.75/credit; Non-Resident: $1036.63/credit. These 2023-24 rates include tuition ($541.02 Resident/$859.90 Non-Resident), a general fee ($64.15), and a graduate business program fee ($112.58).

ProgramName: Master of Science in Management with Concentration in Technological Innovation
EnglishScore: All international applicants must submit evidence of English language proficiency. Acceptable tests and scores are: TOEFL iBT score of 79, TOEFL PBT score of 550, IELTS score of 6.5, PTE Academic score of 53, Duolingo English Test score of 110, or successful completion of ELS Level 112.
Requirements:
In addition to the requirements of the Graduate School, the M.S. in Management program requires:
*   A bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university.
*   Two letters of recommendation.
*   Resume.
*   Statement of purpose.
*   Transcripts from all universities attended.
*   Students for whom English is not their first language must demonstrate English language proficiency through one of the following:
    *   TOEFL: 79 iBT
    *   IELTS: 6.5
    *   PTE: 53
    *   Duolingo: 100
*   The Graduate Management Admission Test (GMAT) and the Graduate Record Examination (GRE) are not required for admission.
Department: College of Business
Description: The Master of Science in Management (M.S.M.) degree is for individuals who want to advance their careers in management. Graduates will possess the skills and knowledge to be an effective manager in a variety of business settings including corporations, non-profits and government agencies. Students have the opportunity to develop skills and expertise in a specific business area by selecting a concentration that aligns with their professional interests. Our unique curriculum allows students to learn from faculty who are experts in their fields and to apply this knowledge to real-world business projects. The Technological Innovation concentration helps students gain a deep understanding of managing for technological innovation, including topics such as research and development, creativity, innovation, product and service design, project management, and technology transfer.
Accredidation: The College of Business is accredited by AACSB International in both business and accounting, an honor held by less than 1% of the world’s business schools.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Management with Concentration in Supply Chain Management
EnglishScore: Applicants who are not native speakers of English must demonstrate English proficiency. The University of Akron accepts the following: a minimum score of 79 on the TOEFL iBT (or 550 pBT), a minimum score of 6.5 on the IELTS, a minimum score of 53 on the PTE Academic, a minimum score of 105 on the Duolingo English Test, or successful completion of level 112 of the ELS Language Centers program.
Department: College of Business
Description: The M.S. in Management with a concentration in Supply Chain Management is designed to prepare students for leadership careers in the dynamic field of supply chain management. This STEM-designated program prepares students with the essential advanced skills in logistics, sourcing, and operations management necessary for success as a supply chain professional. The curriculum provides both breadth and depth in the key areas of supply chain management while maintaining the flexibility to allow students to gain specialized knowledge via elective choices. Students have the option to complete the degree fully online, in-person, or a mix of both. Students will be taught by nationally recognized faculty who are known for their quality teaching and research and will have many opportunities to network with supply chain leaders in the Northeast Ohio business community. In addition, students have the opportunity to earn certifications such as the Certified Supply Chain Associate (CSCA).
Accredidation: Our programs are accredited by AACSB International – The Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business. AACSB is the premier accrediting body for business schools, and we are proud to be among the top 5% of the world's business schools that have earned this distinction. In addition, our accounting program has earned the prestigious separate AACSB Accounting Accreditation, making us one of only 185 schools in the world to hold both business and accounting accreditation.

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Economics
EnglishScore: The TOEFL, IELTS, PTE, or Duolingo is required for most international applicants.
Requirements: To be considered for admission to the M.A. in Economics program, you must meet the general requirements for admission to the Graduate School and hold a bachelor's degree from an accredited institution. Applicants must submit the following materials: Completed online application and the application fee; Official transcripts from all universities and colleges attended; Three letters of recommendation; A statement of goals and objectives. The Graduate Record Examination (GRE) is NOT required. International students must have a TOEFL score of 79 or higher (or equivalent).
Department: Buchtel College of Arts and Sciences
Fees: Approximately $10,698/year for Ohio residents and $15,858/year for non-residents, based on a typical load of 18 credits per year.
Description: The Master of Arts in Economics program offers students advanced training in a wide range of fields in economics including applied microeconomics, econometrics, economic development, financial economics, industrial organization, international economics, labor economics and monetary economics. The degree can prepare you to either enter the job market with an advanced degree or to go on to an economics Ph.D. program. Many students take advantage of our internship program for on-the-job training in a variety of public and private sector jobs. All M.A. students have their own study carrel in the department. Many of our students also work as research or teaching assistants in the department.

ProgramName: Master of Taxation
EnglishScore: International applicants must meet the English language proficiency requirements as established by the Graduate School. Accepted tests and minimum scores include: TOEFL iBT: 79, IELTS: 6.5, PTE Academic: 53, Duolingo English Test: 110, or successful completion of ELS Language Centers level 112.
Requirements: To be admitted to the Master of Taxation (MTax) program, an applicant must have a bachelor's degree from an accredited institution. Applicants must submit the following materials to the Graduate School: Graduate School Application, Application fee, A current résumé, A one-page statement of goals, Official transcripts from ALL universities attended, Two letters of recommendation, Official GMAT/GRE score report. The GMAT or GRE is required for admission unless the applicant qualifies for a waiver.
Department: College of Business
Fees: The estimated total program cost for 30 credits is $24,026.40 for Ohio residents and $35,001.60 for non-residents, based on 2023-24 tuition and fee rates.
Description: The Master of Taxation (M.Tax.) program prepares students for careers as tax professionals in public accounting, industry, and government. The program provides an integrated course of study that focuses on tax research, tax compliance for individuals and various business entities, and the development of tax-planning strategies. Students gain advanced skills in identifying, analyzing, and resolving complex tax issues that face businesses and individuals.
Accredidation: One of only 190 business colleges in the world to have dual AACSB accreditation in both business and accounting.
CostPerCredit: The total cost per credit hour for 2023-24 is approximately $800.88 for Ohio residents and $1,166.72 for non-residents, including all fees.
CollegeApplicationFee: The tuition rate includes a College of Business Graduate Program Fee of $57.25 per credit hour and a General Service Fee (e.g., $60.25 per credit hour for 9+ credits).
